threads.author: @NevetsSreteep
threads.text:
It's clear that this mustached 'officer' is deaf, dumb and blind. Those are the required characteristics to succeed as an agent in law enforcement in the USA. Bonus attributes, displayed by both of the initial responding officers (the mustached one and the bald one that joins in) is a total unwillingness to even entertain anything Peter is saying and a nasty mean streak. They talk over this poor fella, repeating their nonsense over and over, drowning out anything he says, even when he clearly states he does not understand the words they are using. It's baffling how fast this hairless swine goes on the offensive, aggressively trying to overpower a confused man who is trying to be left alone. This man has done nothing wrong. The excuse used to extract his information is that Peter was supposedly tresspassed. There is no evidence of nay of this. At no point have we seen or heard a McDonald's employee tell either the victim or the 'perps' that a tresspass was to be issued. When cops make this type of decision on their own, try to force unlawful conduct upon innocent ppl and end up killing them, maybe it's time to stop and think about what the actual fuck is happening. 

Honestly, as a european citizen i'm appalled by this type of thing and by the sheer number of comparable incidents. To protect and serve was it? Law enforcement in the USA is a joke. And not a funny one at that. What a nightmare.

Maybe I'm just jaded, but "I'm a cop, I believe I have PC, give me a warrant" Seems like the way the system works normally. Even if they fill in "reasons", unless I'm mistaken the judiciary never does any fact checking. If true, the only difference between the two scenarios is how thickly the vinier of bullshit is applied. 
Similarly things happen in traffic court. I've watched cases where it is literally the cop saying someone is guilty, that person pleading not guilty, and the judge rules on the side of the cop on the cop's word alone, without a single shred of evidence or third party witness.

threads.author: @Always_Alpha_1
threads.text:
In my opinion, this was straight up murder. You can clearly see the tyrant grab the man by the neck, deliberately squeezing to inflict pain, knowing that it forces the victim to pull away, which is exactly the reaction the tyrant wanted the public to see, making it look like he‚Äôs resisting instead of just reacting to being hurt. That is all the victim was doing, let‚Äôs be clear about that.

This wasn‚Äôt about letting him go after a simple detainment and ID check, as the tyrant would say and try to have you believe you know that would be his go to line that he would then use.

‚ÄúIf he had just complied, I was simply going to detain him while I ran his name. The cuffs can come off as quick as they went on, he wasn‚Äôt being arrested, it was just a detainment.‚Äù

The tyrant escalated it unnecessarily. Watch closely he even looks around to see if anyone is watching, then when he possibly realizes what he‚Äôs doing with people potentially watching, he pauses for a moment like he knows that he has no valid reason for what he‚Äôs doing, and then he stops. He resumes once backup arrives because he just can‚Äôt resist himself, and now he also has another officer who could justify what he‚Äôs doing. That‚Äôs not justice, that‚Äôs abuse of power, and it cost a man his life. That‚Äôs murder.!

They beat him for nothing, making it seem like he‚Äôs reaching for something, when it was the second tyrant who was holding his arm where it was, and also because the tyrant couldn‚Äôt do what the first tyrant was doing with the arm lock, so he resorted to a violent attack, trying to justify it with ‚Äúoh, he‚Äôs reaching,‚Äù which is what tyrant number 1 said. The victim only pulled his hands straight up to his face to shield himself from these animals because he probably felt what was coming. THAT WAS ALL HE DID, and sure enough, what he thought was coming did, they beat him protecting his face.

If there was any police involvement, it should have been a simple trespass and ‚Äúhave a good day.‚Äù But let‚Äôs be real it shouldn‚Äôt have even been that!

threads.author: @NevetsSreteep
threads.text:
It's clear that this mustached 'officer' is deaf, dumb and blind. Those are the required characteristics to succeed as an agent in law enforcement in the USA. Bonus attributes, displayed by both of the initial responding officers (the mustached one and the bald one that joins in) is a total unwillingness to even entertain anything Peter is saying and a nasty mean streak. They talk over this poor fella, repeating their nonsense over and over, drowning out anything he says, even when he clearly states he does not understand the words they are using. It's baffling how fast this hairless swine goes on the offensive, aggressively trying to overpower a confused man who is trying to be left alone. This man has done nothing wrong. The excuse used to extract his information is that Peter was supposedly tresspassed. There is no evidence of nay of this. At no point have we seen or heard a McDonald's employee tell either the victim or the 'perps' that a tresspass was to be issued. When cops make this type of decision on their own, try to force unlawful conduct upon innocent ppl and end up killing them, maybe it's time to stop and think about what the actual fuck is happening. 

Honestly, as a european citizen i'm appalled by this type of thing and by the sheer number of comparable incidents. To protect and serve was it? Law enforcement in the USA is a joke. And not a funny one at that. What a nightmare.

threads.author: @JasonNewman3
threads.text: My adult son has severe autism.  He doesn't understand police or authority.  But if he's grabbed and made to take his arms behind his back, he would flail relentlessly.  These pigs would have murdered my son, I have no doubt in my mind.
